name: James Gillespies
desc: Over 6 workshops, students at James Gillespies High School transformed a student area in the school into a space that carries the stamp of their self-expression. Participants learned new skills, developed their ideas, and worked as a team to cocreate two murals which are now on display in their student area.
quotes: It was really enjoyable and it taught me a new skill that I hadn't tried before, and I've been doing it outside of school since then. I even got my own spray paints to do my own art at home

The best thing about this project is that it really felt like it came from the young people themselves. The impact on those young people meant that they came into school when they wouldn't have done, they talked to each other in ways they hadn't, they respected each other, they respected learning in a way that some of them had never done before, and they felt proud of themselves. Which was amazing. It was a brilliant thing.

name: Graffiti Intro Workshops
desc: We run these 1 - 3 hour graffiti intro workshops regularly, teaching basic spray paint techniques and culminating in individual pieces that participants can take home. Workshops usually focus on 'space-painting', lettering or stencils.
quotes: It was really enjoyable and it taught me a new skill that I hadn't tried before, and I've been doing it outside of school since then. I even got my own spray paints to do my own art at home.‚Äù - Workshop Participant

name: Plumstead Mural
desc: Dan worked with 10-year-old Timon who won the Plumstead Mural competition, to design and paint a large scale mural on the outside wall of Plumstead Library. Commissioned by Greenwich Council and Tramshed Arts, led by Dan.

name: Growffiti Project
desc: Participants from Edinburgh Young Carers developed a youth allotment area at Bridgend Community Farmhouse, developing skills in graffiti techniques and food growing while being supported to access, participate and feel a sense of belonging at Bridgend. This project had a strong wellbeing focus, evolving the aims and outcomes in alignment with participant needs and interests.

name: Youth Takeover
desc: A day of drop-in graffiti workshops for groups of young people in Greenwich Park. In collaboration with Tramshed Arts.

name: The Concrete Garden Project
desc: A student-run garden project over two years at Hampstead Secondary School, visioned and developed with pupils age 11-14, in collaboration with departments across the school. Students designed and built their own outdoor classroom, with a legacy as an ongoing educational resource for cross-curricular and practical learning in the school. Led by Susannah, with support from Claude Oprea (permaculture teacher) and Edible Landscapes.

name: The Handover Project
desc: Over 100 Hampstead School students came together to produce an album of music about personal experiences and issues that matter to them. Students went on to direct their own music video and develop a marketing campaign for the album. This project was facilitated by 12 creative professionals from diverse artistic and cultural backgrounds, who were able to guide and empower the young people in their creative process. Led by Susannah. Music video by Dorothy Allen-Pickard, music workshop facilitated by Faisal Salah.
quotes: This has genuinely been the most valuable and enriching experience I have ever had at Hampstead. Faisal, Marv and James were engaging, inspirational and positive, which led to students feeling motivated, included and valued. There was a real mix of students in both sessions but all were engaged and had the opportunity to be part of something. It was so wonderful to see students who have never been interested in the past, singing, beatboxing and clapping! I believe that students will leave today with a different perspective, feeling inspired and with a huge amount of positivity - not just about music, but about life! This has been the most exceptional day. Can you please come back?!.

name: Enrichment Day
desc: Two enrichment days at Hampstead School introduced year 9 students to exciting new ideas and interests. Workshops were led by local creatives and practitioners, and included mosaic making, bicycle powered machines, bread baking, permaculture, painting patterns in nature, and protest art. Led by Susannah.
quotes: It was very creative and very amazing. I have never experienced a lesson that can make me more confident about who I am and more passionate about what I do.
Students were engaged, directing their own learning. Real learning was happening. There was freedom to learn without an agenda.
This hasn't just been the most enriching day I've ever experienced at Hampstead School; this has been the most enriching day of my life!

name: Girls Bike Project
desc: Young people on the 'community cycle works' program will design and create a logo for their local
